description:
After a global financial crisis, the world is engulfed in an AI-driven "sustainable war." It's up to Section 9 to counter new forms of cyber threats.

(Source: Netflix)
synonyms: โกสต์ อิน เดอะ เชลล์: SAC_2045

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

title.native: 攻殻機動隊 STAND ALONE COMPLEX Solid State Society
攻殻機動隊 SAC_2045 シーズン２

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/snjaramaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒牧伸志) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinji_Aramaki)

Aramaki is one of the leading figures in the industry's CG animation, and is noted for his various design works in numerous anime series such as [Gasaraki](https://anilist.co/anime/782/), [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) among many others.

Influenced by [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/), [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), and Star Wars during his junior and senior high school years, he decided to pursue a career in film. One of his first representative works was an independently produced animation titled "Moonstruck Artemis," that he made while part of a manga club during his university days. Aramaki didn't have a special desire to work in the animation industry, but has stated joining it solely because he could draw and the industry had a wide range of options for someone like that. He has also said that the spread of digital technology has made it easier for him to work in both anime and live-action.

In 2004, Aramaki directed [Appleseed](https://anilist.co/anime/54/), a re-interpretation of a [Shirou Masamune](https://anilist.co/staff/97609/) manga by [the same name](https://anilist.co/manga/30668/). Although bashed by critics, the movie was an influential piece in the medium that had great impact on creators around the world. Studio Ghibli co-founder [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) said the movie would reform the industry.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kixyuubann) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/神山健治)

He has worked regularly with the anime studio and production enterprise, Production I.G, such as his work on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/), Patlabor, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), and for whom he has directed the [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/) anime series. In 2002 he made his directorial debut with [MiniPato](https://anilist.co/anime/2733/).

In 2007, he directed the TV series [Guardian of the Sacred Spirit](https://anilist.co/anime/1827/) and [Eden of the East](https://anilist.co/anime/5630/).

Started his career as a background artist.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kuvshinov_Ilya) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=789222) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kuvshinov_ilya) | [ArtStation](https://www.artstation.com/kuvshinov_ilya) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/kuvshinov-ilya) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/KuvshinovIlia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Mad1Artist) | [Vimeo](https://vimeo.com/kuvshinovilya) | [Tumblr](http://kuvshinov-ilya.tumblr.com/)

Ilya Kuvshinov is a Russian born animator, illustrator and designer.

Shirow studied oil painting at Osaka University of Arts. While in college, he developed an interest in manga, which led him to create his own complete work, Black Magic, which was published in the manga dōjinshi Atlas. His work caught the eye of Seishinsha President Harumichi Aoki, who offered to publish him.

The result was best-selling manga Appleseed, a full volume of densely plotted drama taking place in an ambiguous future. The story was a sensation, and won the 1986 Seiun Award for Best Manga. After a professional reprint of Black Magic and a second volume of Appleseed, he released Dominion in 1986. Two more volumes of Appleseed followed before he began work on Ghost in the Shell.

In 2007, he collaborated again with Production I.G to co-create the original concept for the anime television series Shinreigari/Ghost Hound, Production I.G's 20th anniversary project. A further original collaboration with Production I.G began airing in April 2008, titled Real Drive.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daikitsuneta) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daikitsuneta/)__

__Daiki Tsuneta__ is a musician, composer, lyricist, arranger, producer, guitarist and cellist. He is the vocalist and guitarist of [King Gnu](https://anilist.co/staff/157033). He's also part of the creative group [millenium parade](https://anilist.co/staff/158732).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Dooonermhoi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ermhoi/) | [Bandcamp](https://ermhoi.bandcamp.com/releases) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/ermhoi)

Ermhoi is a japanese-irish musician. She is also part of [millenium parade](https://anilist.co/staff/158732).

[Website](https://millenniumparade.com/)

**millennium parade** is a creative group involving various artists, including [Daiki Tsuneta](https://anilist.co/staff/158731), [Kazuki Arai](https://anilist.co/staff/183237) and Yuu Seki of [King Gnu](https://anilist.co/staff/157033), [ermhoi](https://anilist.co/staff/158733), Kento Nagatsuka and Ayatake Ezaki of WONK and more.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daikitsuneta) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daikitsuneta/)__

__Daiki Tsuneta__ is a musician, composer, lyricist, arranger, producer, guitarist and cellist. He is the vocalist and guitarist of [King Gnu](https://anilist.co/staff/157033). He's also part of the creative group [millenium parade](https://anilist.co/staff/158732).

__[Website](http://projectmili.com)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ProjectMili)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/projectmili/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ProjectMili)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ProjectMili)__

Indie band “Mili” consists of: Canadian vocalist [Cassie Wei](https://anilist.co/staff/188041/Cassie-Wei), capable of writing lyrics in three languages. Composer and arranger [Yamato Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/168859), with a proven track record of providing music to various artists, such as Higuchi Ai, DAOKO, and Hanazawa Kana. Bassist [Yukihito Mitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/189705/Yukihito-Mitomo) and drummer [Shoto Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/189704/Shoto-Yoshida) are long-time musicians who have gone through both indie and major debuts. Animator, illustrator, and character designer [Ao Fujimori](https://anilist.co/staff/159213/Ao-Fujimori), an experienced animation director, is in charge of Mili's visual artwork.

Mili has written music for popular anime and game titles such as "Ghost in the Shell", "Goblin Slayer", "Limbus Company", "Library of Ruina", "ENDER LILIES", and "Promise of Wizard". They create music in various genres, such as classical, electronic, rock, and jazz, while maintaining a high level of quality. They handle music, visual art, merchandise, management, and business all by themselves. Mili is fully in control of their production and is recognized as a unique presence both domestically and internationally.

They are also producing many songs for anime, game, and IT companies in Japan, Korea, China, Canada, and Poland.

(Source: Spotify, edited)

Mary Elizabeth McGlynn is an American voice actress, ADR director and singer-songwriter best known for her involvement in music production in multiple games from the Silent Hill series, and her extensive English-language dubbing of various anime, animated films and video games.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/momocashew)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/momocashew/)__

Cassie Wei is a Chinese-Canadian vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of [Mili](https://anilist.co/staff/129398/Mili).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/momocashew)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/momocashew/)__

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kixyuubann) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/神山健治)

In 2002 he made his directorial debut with [MiniPato](https://anilist.co/anime/2733/).

In 2007, he directed the TV series [Guardian of the Sacred Spirit](https://anilist.co/anime/1827/) and [Eden of the East](https://anilist.co/anime/5630/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HAMOloid) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hamoloid/)__

__Yamato Kasai__, alternatively known as HAMO, is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of classical music group [Mili](https://anilist.co/staff/129398/Mili).

[Website](https://www.kazumajinnouchi.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazjin2612) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kazjin2612/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2UM9kTNJPoOHuN4yeDT54i?si=DoouJseMTge-lP6B2PYLhg)

Kazuma Jinnouchi is Japanese music composer based in Seattle and Los Angeles. He is best known for composing the music of Microsoft’s blockbuster video game Halo 5: Guardians., for which he received BAFTA Games Awards nomination in Best Music category; as well as the critically-acclaimed video game Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots.
